    Run Taxon Profiles

    run_txprofile.Rd

    Load data needed and run or update demographic analyses for the list of species selected

    run_txprofile(
  taxa,
  Species_list,
  ZIMSdir,
  AnalysisDir,
  PlotDir,
  extractDate,
  minDate = "1980-01-01",
  Sections,
  erase_previous = FALSE,
  sexCats = c("Male", "Female"),
  inparallel = FALSE,
  ipara = 1,
  npara = 1,
  minN = 50,
  maxOutl = 99,
  spOutLev = NULL,
  minNsur = 50,
  minlx = 0.1,
  MinBirthKnown = 0.3,
  models_sur = "GO",
  shape = "bathub",
  niter = 25000,
  burnin = 5001,
  thinning = 20,
  nchain = 3,
  ncpus = 2,
  parentProb = 80,
  minNrepro = 100,
  minNparepro = 30,
  minNseas = 50,
  minNgro = 100,
  minNIgro = 50,
  MeasureType = "",
  models_gro = "vonBertalanffy"
)

    Arguments

    taxa

    character the name of the taxa studied

    Species_list

    vector of character Species selected

    ZIMSdir

    character directory where to find data

    AnalysisDir

    character directory where to save results

    PlotDir

    character Directory to save the plots. Default = NULL, no plot is saved

    extractDate

    character 'YYYY-MM-DD' Date of data extraction

    minDate

    character 'YYYY-MM-DD' Earlier date to include data

    Sections

    vector of character names of the sections to update in the taxon profile results: "sur", "rep" and/or "gro". Default = c("sur", "rep", "gro")

    erase_previous

    logical whether the current result file should be deleted (before being replaced). Default = FALSE

    sexCats

    character Male, Female or All Default = "All"

    inparallel

    logical Whether this function is run in parallel on different computer. In other words: should the species list be divided? Default = FALSE

    ipara

    numeric Id number of the computer used to select the species to run

    npara

    numeric number of computers used in parallel

    minN

    numeric Minimum number of individuals. Default = 50

    maxOutl

    numeric Maximum threshold for the longevity distribution. Default = NULL

    spOutLev

    vector of character List of species for which the Maximum threshold for the longevity distribution.XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

    minNsur

    numeric Minimum number of individuals to run the survival analysis. Default = 50

    minlx

    numeric between 0 and 1. Minimum reached survivorship from the raw Kaplan Meier analysis needed to run the survival analysis. Default = 0.1

    MinBirthKnown

    numeric between 0 and 1. Minimum proportion of individuals with a known birth month in the data. Default = 0.3

    models_sur

    vector of characters names of the survival basta models to run: "G0", "EX", "LO" and/or "WE". see ?basta for more information. Default = "GO"

    shape

    character shape of the survival basta model to run: "simple", "Makeham", "bathtub". see ?basta for more information. Default = "simple"

    niter

    numeric. number of MCMC iterations to run the survival model. see ?basta for more information. Default = 25000

    burnin

    numeric Number of iterations removed so that the survival model has time to converge. see ?basta for more information. Default = 5001

    thinning

    numeric Number of iteration to run the survival model before saving a set of parameters. see ?basta for more information. Default = 20

    nchain

    numeric Number of chains to run the survival model. Default = 5001

    ncpus

    numeric Number of computer core to use. Default = 2

    parentProb

    numeric XXXXXXXXXXX

    minNrepro

    numeric XXXXXXXXXXX

    minNparepro

    numeric XXXXXXXXXXX

    minNseas

    numeric XXXXXXXXXXX

    minNgro

    numeric Minimum number of weight needed to fit the growth models

    minNIgro

    numeric Minimum number of unique individuals needed to fit the growth models

    MeasureType

    vector of characters Name of the type of measurements that should be included. Default = NULL, all measurement type are included.

    models_gro

    vector of characters indicating the growth models that need to be fit.The following models are supported : logistic, gompertz, chapmanRichards, vonBertalanffy, polynomial. default = "vonBertalanffy"

    Value

    Save and replace the result file for each specie sin the list. The file is saved in analysisDir\taxa\species.Rdata

    Examples

    # # Here is an example but use directly your own ZIMSdir(directory to find data) and analysisDir(directory to save analysis)
# file = system.file("coretest.csv", package = 'ISRverse')
# ZIMSdir = dirname(file)
# AnalysisDir = paste0(tempdir(check = TRUE),'\temp')
# PlotDir = paste0(tempdir(check = TRUE),'\temp\plot')
# dir.create(AnalysisDir)
# dir.create(PlotDir)
# 
# #This code run the survival analysis for gorilla
# out <- run_txprofile(taxa = "Mammalia", Species_list = c('Gorilla gorilla'), 
#                           ZIMSdir = RastDir, AnalysisDir = AnalysisDir,
#                           PlotDir = PlotDir,
#                           extractDate = "", 
#                           minDate = "1980-01-01",
#                           Sections = "sur", 
#                           sexCats = c('Male', 'Female'),
#                          niter = 1000, burnin = 101, thinning = 10, nchain = 3, ncpus = 3
# )
# 
# list.files(PlotDir)
# list.files(AnalysisDir)
# 
# unlink(AnalysisDir, recursive = TRUE)


if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Here is an example but use directly your own ZIMSdir(directory to find data) and analysisDir(directory #' to save analysis)
file = system.file("coretest.csv", package = 'ISRverse')
ZIMSdir = dirname(file)
analysisDir = paste0(tempdir(check = TRUE),'\\temp')
PlotDir = paste0(tempdir(check = TRUE),'\\temp\\plot')
dir.create(analysisDir)
dir.create(PlotDir)

#Here I want to split my analysis on two computers
#Run on computer 1:
out <- run_txprofile(taxa = "Mammalia", Species_list = c('Gorilla gorilla', "Capreolus capreolus"), 
                          ZIMSdir = RastDir, analysisDir = analysisDir,
                         PlotDir = PlotDir,
                       extractDate = "", 
                          minDate = "1980-01-01",
                          Sections = "sur", 
                          sexCats = c('Male', 'Female'), 
                          inparallel = TRUE, 
                          ipara = 1, npara = 2
)


#Run on computer 2:
out <- run_txprofile(taxa = "Mammalia", Species_list = c('Gorilla gorilla', "Capreolus capreolus"), 
                          ZIMSdir = RastDir, analysisDir = analysisDir,
                          PlotDir = PlotDir,
                      extractDate = "", 
                          minDate = "1980-01-01",
                          Sections = "sur", 
                          sexCats = c('Male', 'Female'), 
                          inparallel = TRUE,
                           ipara = 2, npara = 2
)
list.files(PlotDir)
list.files(AnalysisDir)

unlink(analysisDir, recursive = TRUE)
} # }
